sense.name: pass into by penetrating or permeating
sense.examples: His fibs have infiltrated the media. Retinoblastoma has infiltrated the optic nerve. How likely is it that mold will infiltrate a gas central heating system? 'Smart' technologies will infiltrate the natural environment.

sense.name: unobtrusively enter a group or organization to spy or subvert it
sense.examples: An undercover British agent infiltrated the group. In October they infiltrated the Point Carbon conference to oppose carbon-trading. They were convinced that communists had infiltrated the CBC.

sense.name: pass through an enemy line
sense.examples: During the war, elite Israel Defense Forces troops infiltrated the area repeatedly. Sri Lankan troops infiltrated separatist Tamil rebel territory in the embattled north.
